content:
• Wednesday, February 6, 2013
  • ALL

    More on Allstate (NYSE:ALL): Q4 surprises with a profit, a new buyback program and its largest...

    More on Allstate (NYSE:ALL): Q4 surprises with a profit, a new buyback program and its largest dividend increase since the financial crisis - despite taking a $1.1B hit from superstorm Sandy. Operating EPS of $0.59 blew away expectations of a $0.05 loss, driven by higher investment income and improved underwriting results outside of the tri-state area. Shares +2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 PM
  • NOK

    French telecom-equipment giant Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) is expected to announce that CEO Ben...

    French telecom-equipment giant Alcatel-Lucent (ALU) is expected to announce that CEO Ben Verwaayen will step down as the company continues to bleed cash and get battered by competition. Verwaayen's contract is due to expire May 7, but expectations are the he will stay on until a replacement is found. ALU is expected to report earnings tomorrow, which are likely show another decline in quarterly operating income and a seventh consecutive year of negative cash flow. Shares -1.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • TRLG

    More on True Religion (NASDAQ:TRLG): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue estimates as total sales...

    More on True Religion (NASDAQ:TRLG): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue estimates as total sales rise by 14.8% Y/Y. Net profit fell 6.8% however, as the jeans maker recorded a 21% increase in overhead costs from new store openings, which offset the higher sales. Gross margin widened slightly to 64.3% from 64.1%. Looking ahead to FY13, the company guides above Street expectations, now anticipating an EPS of between $1.89 to $1.95 on revenue of $509M to $513M. Analysts are looking for $1.86 on revenue of $495M. Shares +3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 PM
  • GEOS

    More on Geospace Technologies (NASDAQ:GEOS): FQ1 easily beats estimates, as total sales jumped...

    More on Geospace Technologies (NASDAQ:GEOS): FQ1 easily beats estimates, as total sales jumped 80% Y/Y, and net income soared by 153% over the same period. Wireless product sales led the way with revenues of $46.9M, driven by strong sales of its GSX system. Reservoir products sales also increased to $11.2M, driven by the recognition of $8.7M of revenues from Statoil. Traditional seismic product sales were level with last year, while non-seismic product orders declined slightly. Shares +4.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 PM
  • ATGE

    More on DeVry (DV): FQ2 beats on all counts, despite a 3.6% downtick in total sales for the...

    More on DeVry (DV): FQ2 beats on all counts, despite a 3.6% downtick in total sales for the quarter. Net earnings increased five-fold despite the decline in revenue, as impairment charges weighed on year-earlier results. However, declining enrollments continue unabated. Total undergraduate enrollment declined 18% for the November session, while new enrollments fell 16%. Total student enrollment over the same period decreased 12% to 62,899. Shares +13.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 PM
  • LF

    More on LeapFrog (NYSE:LF): Q4 beats on the top line at total sales jump by +16% Y/Y. Net...

    More on LeapFrog (NYSE:LF): Q4 beats on the top line at total sales jump by +16% Y/Y. Net earnings soared 90% however, on strong demand for the LeapPad 2 children's tablet over the holiday season. For the current quarter, it sees a loss of between $0.07 and $0.09 a share on a net sales gain of about 10%. Analysts are projecting a $0.12 loss on 5% top-line growth. The company declines to offer full-year targets, saying it's awaiting more clarity about tax accounting. Shares +5.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 PM

  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +5.7%) continued its winter to remember today, possibly aided by favorable...

    Netflix (NFLX +5.7%) continued its winter to remember today, possibly aided by favorable comments from Disney (NYSE:DIS) CEO Bob Iger during the media giant's FQ1 earnings call. When asked about the impact Disney's movie deal with Netflix could have on Disney Channel viewing and pay-TV relationships, Iger stated Disney "thought long and hard" about the impact, and concluded the deal was a "movie play" that wouldn't hurt Disney Channel. Also: Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) CEO Jeff Bewkes offered Netflix (both a customer and rival) guarded praise during TWX's earnings call. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: DV +13%. ZUMZ +8%. WNC +7%. ABMD +6%. LF +6%.

  • NWSA

    More on News Corp (NASDAQ:NWSA): Q4 beats across the board as net earnings more-than doubled on...

    More on News Corp (NASDAQ:NWSA): Q4 beats across the board as net earnings more-than doubled on one-time gains related to acquisitions and strength in its cable networks division. Net profit totaled $2.4B, compared with $1.1B a year earlier. Much of the increase was related to the acquisition of the 50% stakes in Fox Sports Australia and Fox Star Sports Asia that the company didn't already own. Publishing revenue was relatively flat. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) +2.3% AH after announcing a non-exclusive display ad deal with Google...

    Yahoo (YHOO) +2.3% AH after announcing a non-exclusive display ad deal with Google (NASDAQ:GOOG). Targeted Google AdSense Web ads and AdMob mobile ads will be shown on Yahoo properties; Yahoo (given its size) will presumably get a more favorable revenue cut than most Google partners. The deal is a major feather in Google's cap - its display ad ops have been growing quickly, but face tough competition from Facebook and others - and should strengthen its mobile ad leadership. Yahoo search partner Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) can't be pleased.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • AKAM

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) guides on its Q4 call for Q1 revenue of $352M-$362M and EPS of $0.50-$0.52;...

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) guides on its Q4 call for Q1 revenue of $352M-$362M and EPS of $0.50-$0.52; the latter is above a consensus of $0.47, but the former is below a consensus of $370.7M. Akamai blames the top-line guidance on a decision to wind down certain low-margin media delivery contracts, as well as the sale of its ad targeting business and forex. Q4 EPS received a $0.04 boost from a tax rate change, and Q1 EPS is expected to benefit from tax rates and an extended depreciation cycle for servers (400 bps gross margin boost). Shares -15.9% AH. LLNW is likely to fall in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • SGMO

    More on Sangamo Biosciences (NASDAQ:SGMO): Q4 beats on both top and bottom line as higher...

    More on Sangamo Biosciences (NASDAQ:SGMO): Q4 beats on both top and bottom line as higher revenues were generated from the Company's collaboration agreements with Shire (NASDAQ:SHPG), Dow AgroSciences (DAS) and Sigma-Aldrich Corporation (NASDAQ:SIAL), plus additional research grants. The company guides FY2013 revenue slightly to the lower side of estimates, now expecting to earn between $20M -24M, versus the consensus of $23.09M. Shares -1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM

  • OSUR

    More on OraSure Technologies (NASDAQ:OSUR): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue estimates, but the...

    More on OraSure Technologies (NASDAQ:OSUR): Q4 beats on both EPS and revenue estimates, but the stock is trading lower in the post-session due to weak guidance. Total sales declined 7% Y/Y, as higher cryosurgical systems sales were offset by lower sales of it's infectious disease testing, substance abuse testing and insurance risk assessment products. For FY13, the company expects a Q1 EPS loss of $0.19 - $0.18 per share on revenues of $20M - $21M. The Street view is for a loss of $0.12 per share on revenues of $23.08M. Shares -4% AH.

    More on Green Mountain Coffee Roasters' (NASDAQ:GMCR) FQ1: The company sold 4.95M Keurig brewers...

    More on Green Mountain Coffee Roasters' (NASDAQ:GMCR) FQ1: The company sold 4.95M Keurig brewers during the period, up 18% from a year ago. Gross margin was up 220 bps to 31.3% due to lower green coffee costs. Green Mountain Coffee Roasters sees FY2013 EPS of $2.72-2.82, compared to the consensus mark of analysts calling for $2.71. GMCR -8.1% AH with investors seeming to have been expecting a stronger beat. (PR)

    Deutsche Bank cuts Elan (ELN -9.9%) to Hold on the back of its sale of Tysabri to Biogen (BIIB...

    Deutsche Bank cuts Elan (ELN -9.9%) to Hold on the back of its sale of Tysabri to Biogen (BIIB +2.1%). Deutsche says the decision looks attractive because ELN "swapped hope for certainty." However, uncertainty over the use of the proceeds forces it to move to the sidelines.

  • AUDC

    Enterprise VoIP hardware provider AudioCodes (AUDC +8.9%) closes sharply higher after SA...

    Enterprise VoIP hardware provider AudioCodes (AUDC +8.9%) closes sharply higher after SA contributor David Ritchie argues Oracle's purchase of Acme Packet could lead Microsoft, Juniper, or Dell to make a bid for the company. Ritchie notes the integration of AudioCodes' enterprise session border controllers with Microsoft's Lync unified communications platform, and sees the adoption of VoIP-based mobile apps (I, II) increasing AUDC's value. He also thinks the recent appointment of i-banker Stanley Stern to AUDC's board suggests the company is on the block.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO +1.9%) advances ahead of its Q4 earnings report scheduled after today's close, as...

    Tesoro (TSO +1.9%) advances ahead of its Q4 earnings report scheduled after today's close, as Simmons analysts upgrade shares to Overweight from Neutral, based on “expectations of earnings upward momentum" based on valuation and recent acquisitions, among other factors. Consensus EPS expectations run ~$1.46. Refining peers VLO, HES and MPC are up ~25% YTD, while TSO +16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • SLGN

    Silgan Holdings (SLGN -1.1%) slips after Citigroup cut the shares from Buy to Neutral on...

    Silgan Holdings (SLGN -1.1%) slips after Citigroup cut the shares from Buy to Neutral on valuation earlier today. Citi says the stock is fairly valued at 7.9x EBITDA, and while it likes the predictability of SLGN's high quality portfolio and expect returns to improve in 2013-14, the improvement is largely priced into the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • HBM

    HudBay Minerals (HBM +2.5%), expecting to more than quadruple copper output by 2015, seeks to...

    HudBay Minerals (HBM +2.5%), expecting to more than quadruple copper output by 2015, seeks to capitalize on a buyers’ market for mining assets as small companies struggle to raise funds and larger competitors consider sales, CEO David Garofalo says. HBM plans to focus on smaller deals in countries such as Peru, Mexico, Colombia and Brazil.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • ABMD

    Abiomed (ABMD -6.1%) takes a hit after the medical device company missed on its Q4 EPS result...

    Abiomed (ABMD -6.1%) takes a hit after the medical device company missed on its Q4 EPS result earlier this morning, and reaffirmed an FY13 guidance that trails Street expectations. It now forecasts revenue of $155M to $157M, lagging consensus by around $1M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • FOE

    Ferro (FOE +2.5%) moves higher today after saying it's sold assets related to its solar pastes...

    Ferro (FOE +2.5%) moves higher today after saying it's sold assets related to its solar pastes business to Heraeus, a private global precious metals and technology company based in Hanau, Germany. Financial details of the transaction were not disclosed. With the sale, FOE will eliminate operating losses associated with the solar business. For FY13, FOE now expects EPS of $0.25 to $0.30, higher than estimates of $0.23.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • GNRC

    Shares of Generac (GNRC +1%) move higher today on reports of the possibility of a foot of snow...

    Shares of Generac (GNRC +1%) move higher today on reports of the possibility of a foot of snow coming with the winter storm that is due to hit the Northeast. Although the storm is giving a nice boost to shares, it's nothing compared to the 9% jump the stock received in the face of Hurricane Sandy last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 2 Comments

    Uranium Resources (URRE -5.7%) reaches a 52-week low after announcing terms of its previously...

    Uranium Resources (URRE -5.7%) reaches a 52-week low after announcing terms of its previously announced rights offering, in which all existing shareholders and warrant holders may participate on an equal, proportional basis in purchasing common shares. URRE will launch the rights offering tomorrow, seeking to raise up to $13M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • CMG

    Shares of Chipotle (CMG +4.9%) trade at their highest level of the year despite guidance from...

    Shares of Chipotle (CMG +4.9%) trade at their highest level of the year despite guidance from the company which indicates the former growth high-flyer expects same-restaurant sales to pick up at low single digit pace in 2013. The bullish sentiment appears to be tied in part to the price hikes which the company plans on passing on to consumers at some point this year in order to offset food input costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • MMM

    3M (MMM +1.2%) moves higher today as investors cheer yesterday's announcement of a dividend hike...

    3M (MMM +1.2%) moves higher today as investors cheer yesterday's announcement of a dividend hike and share repurchase, plus the board of directors says it's elected Muhtar Kent, chairman of the board and CEO of Coca-Cola (NYSE:KO), to it's board of directors, effective April 1, 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • ELLI

    Ellie Mae (ELLI +4.4%) rallies after SA contributor Shareholders Unite argues the...

    Ellie Mae (ELLI +4.4%) rallies after SA contributor Shareholders Unite argues the mortgage-processing software maker's post-earnings selloff is overdone. Investors have long been aware of declining mortgage refi activity and fewer conversions of traditional software customers to cloud subscriptions (the focus of a recent William Blair downgrade), the author declares. Meanwhile, top-line growth is still healthy, and rising margins are evidence of significant operating leverage.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM

    Magellan Health Services (MGLN +1.5%) and Performant Financial Corp. (PFMT +1%) both move higher...

    Magellan Health Services (MGLN +1.5%) and Performant Financial Corp. (PFMT +1%) both move higher today after announcing that they have formed a strategic relationship to offer payment integrity recovery services to MGLN's commercial specialty pharmacy customers through Magellan Pharmacy Solutions.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • EXPE

    Expedia (EXPE -2.6%) has given up the AH gains it saw following a mixed Q4 report that featured...

    Expedia (EXPE -2.6%) has given up the AH gains it saw following a mixed Q4 report that featured strong hotel bookings - shares had risen over 30% since Expedia's Q3 beat, leading to heightened expectations. RBC's Mark Mahaney (recently fired from Citi) has downgraded shares to Sector Perform, predicting Expedia is "is likely now to enter a period of growth deceleration." Management stated on the earnings call it expects tougher European competition from Priceline/Kayak (PCLN +0.5%), and estimated mobile now makes up ~20% of transactions. TRIP +2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • GME

    GameStop (GME -6.9%) is defended by both Piper Jaffray and SunTrust after a report from a gaming...

    GameStop (GME -6.9%) is defended by both Piper Jaffray and SunTrust after a report from a gaming blog caught investors by surprise with its revelation that the next Microsoft Xbox console could limit the sale of used games. Both firms counter the argument, saying new consoles introduced this year will support used games and their introduction won't create as big of a market disruption as the original report indicates.Shares of GMEare off lows, but still trade down with volume 3X normal activity.
